bib_record.title: -MEASUREMENTS OF KEV NEUTRON CAPTURE CROSS SECTIONS WITH A 4-PI BARIUM FLUORIDE DETECTOR: EXAMPLES OF 93-NB, 103-RH, AND 181-TA.

free_txt: G.R.
MAIN REFERENCE, DATA ARE GIVEN
3-MV VAN DE GRAAFF ACCELERATOR,
REPETITION RATE 250 HZ, PULSE WIDTH 2 NS AND BEAM
INTENSITY 2 MICRO-AMP.

free_txt: .NORMALISATION TO EQUAL N FLUX FOR ALL SAMPLES TO
ACCOUNT FOR DECREASE IN N SOURCE YIELD WITH TIME
.SAMPLE-INDEPENDENT BACKGROUND, BOTH TIME-DEPENDENT AND
TIME-INDEPENDENT
.BACKGROUND FROM SAMPLE SCATTERED NEUTRONS
.CAPTURE EVENTS FALLING BELOW THE THRESHOLD
.NEUTRON MULTIPLE SCATTERING AND SELF-SHIELDING
.GAMMA SELF-ABSORPTION IN THE AU SAMPLES WAS MUCH LESS
THAN 1 % AND WAS NEGLECTED
4-PI BARIUM FLOURIDE (BAF2) DETECTOR CONSISTING
OF 42 SHAPED CRYSTALS MOUNTED IN A SPHERICAL AL HONEY-
COMB STRUCTURE, EACH COVERED BY A REFLECTOR AND A
CANNING OF 0.5 MM TOTAL THICKNESS AND VIEWED BY A
PHOTOTUBE WITH QUARTZ WINDOW. THUS EACH CRYSTAL REPRE-
SENTS A COMPLETE GAMMA DETECTOR MODULE. THE WHOLE
ASSEMBLY IS USED AS A CALORIMETER, WITH ONLY THE SUM
ENERGY SIGNAL AND THE TOF RECORDED, TOGETHER WITH A 42
BIT PATTERN INDICATING WHICH MODULES DETECTED THE
EVENT. FOR THE EXPERIMENT 2 OF THE 42 MODULES WERE
REMOVED, AT THE ENTRANCE AND EXIT OF THE N BEAM, THUS
REDUCING THE SOLID ANGLE COVERED TO 95 %.
SUM ENERGY RESOLUTION 14.3 % AT 662 KEV, 7.1 % AT
2.5 MEV AND 6.0 % AT 6.1 MEV. PEAK EFFICIENCY OF 93 %
OBTAINED FOR THE 662 KEV GAMMA OF 137-CS, AND AT
HIGHER ENERGIES 82 % FOR THE 1.17/1.33 MEV GAMMAS OF
60-CO. TIME RESOLUTION WAS 630 PSEC WITH 60-CO SOURCE.
TWO 6-LI GLASS SCINTILLATION DETECTORS USED AS
N MONITORS; THE FIRST LOCATED IN THE N COLLIMATOR
20 CM FROM THE N PRODUCING TARGET TO MEASURE INTEGRAL
N FLUX, THE SECOND IN THE N BEAM DIRECTION LOOKING
THROUGH THE SAMPLE AT A FLIGHT PATH OF 2.5 M TO
ACCUMULATE THE TOF SPECTRUM AND THUS MEASURE THE TIME-
CORRELATED INTEGRAL N FLUX.
3-MV VAN DE GRAAFF ACCELERATOR,
REPETITION RATE 250 HZ, PULSE WIDTH 2 NS AND BEAM
INTENSITY 2 MICRO-AMP.
METALLIC LI OF ABOUT 2 MG/CM2 EVAPORATED ONTO A
WATER COOLED CU BACKING 0.3 MM THICK. USING A P ENERGY
OF APPROX 2 MEV PRODUCES CONTINUOUS N SPECTRA IN THE
REQUIRED ENERGY RANGE FROM 3 - 200 KEV. THE WHOLE N
PRODUCING TARGET SURROUNDED BY A MIXED BORON CARBIDE/
ARALDITE SHIELD OF 1 M3 VOLUME, WITH A CENTRAL
SEPARATE BEAM COLLIMATOR INCLUDING A 25 CM SURROUND OF
BORON LOADED PARAFFIN AND, TOWARDS THE BAF2 DETECTOR,
A 10 CM LEAD SHIELD TO SUPPRESS GAMMAS PRODUCED IN THE
N TARGET AND COLLIMATOR ITSELF.
SHORT FLIGHT PATH OF 77 CM.
.EIGHT SAMPLES WERE LOADED IN A COMPUTER CONTROLLED
AUTO-CHANGER AND STEPPED THROUGH THE BAF2 DETECTOR AT
10 MIN INTERVALS. AS WELL AS THE THREE ISOTOPES UNDER
STUDY, THERE WERE TWO IDENTICAL 197-AU MONITOR
SAMPLES, A GRAPHITE SAMPLE TO SIMULATE BACKGROUND FROM
SAMPLE SCATTERED NEUTRONS, A 59-CO SAMPLE TO VERIFY
THE N ENERGY SCALE VIA WELL DEFINED N RESONANCES, AND
AN EMPTY POSITION TO DETERMINE SAMPLE-INDEPENDENT
BACKGROUND. THE ORDER AND DETAILS OF THE SAMPLES ARE:
THICKNESS        WEIGHT     PURITY
SAMPLE       MM  10-3 A/BARN     G          %
8  NO SAMPLE
ALL METALLIC SAMPLES OF 22 MM DIAMETER
